articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Cambodian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Cambodian Ambassador
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Wednesday met and had a talk with outgoing Cambodian Ambassador to the DPRK Chhorn Hay.

articles.title: S. Korean Military's Provocative Burlesque against DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Military's Provocative Burlesque against DPRK under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea Wednesday gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA as regards the south Korean military authorities' unpardonable provocative burlesque hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK:
					 Recently, the puppet military group staged such provocative farce as letting the soldiers who completed a recruit training course chant an unspeakable slogan hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK at a graduation ceremony of the recruit training unit of the 17th division of the south Korean army even with their parents attending.
					
					 It was reported that the puppet soldiers were forced to shout such slogans at ordinary times, to say nothing of the time before their meals or while they were on the move.
					
					 This is thrice-cursed crime as it is another hideous provocation to the DPRK.
					
					  It is well known that the puppet military group displayed slogans hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK at the barracks, posts and military facilities in the past and fired bullets and shells at the targets symbolic of the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, kicking up confrontation hysteria.
					
					 This touched off surging indignation among the service personnel and people of the DPRK and hardened their resolution to wipe out the enemy. Accordingly, this was bitterly censured by the public at home and abroad.
					
					 Nevertheless, the puppet group has persisted in such provocative farces overtly and covertly, without repenting of its reckless acts even a bit.
					
					 The recent hideous crime is part of those provocations, a clear indication that the puppet group is despicable confrontation maniacs. 
					
					 The Park Geun Hye group set up even the "Mental Training School for National Defense" modeled on the "Mental Training School of the ROK" dating back to the period of "yusin" dictatorship. It is busy infusing bitterness toward compatriots and war fever into the puppet soldiers. 
					
					 Not content with kicking up a racket for "eliminating the forces following the north," the group is desperately perpetrating such hideous provocation as hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. This cannot be construed otherwise than a last-ditch effort to calm down the south Korean public infuriated by the fraudulent election, fascist dictatorship and the revival of "yusin", prevent the puppet soldiers from vacillating, tide over the crisis and justify its confrontation and war moves.
					
					 It is ridiculous, indeed, for the Park Geun Hye group to talk about "confidence-building" and "summit talks" while daring hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, the life and soul of its service personnel and people.
					
					 Does the group have the face to call for "stop to speaking ill of the head of state"?
					
					 As the DPRK has already served warnings, it will never pardon those who hurt the dignity of its supreme leadership but mercilessly punish them.
					
					 The Park group had better behave itself, clearly understanding what dear price it will have to pay for having hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.

articles.title: South Korean Puppet Group Accused of Its Moves to Suppress Progress, Democracy
articles.content:
South Korean Puppet Group Accused of Its Moves to Suppress Progress, Democracy
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Art and Literature of Korea (GFUALK) issued the following statement on Tuesday accusing the south Korean puppet group of traitors of its moves to suppress social progress and democracy:
					 Facing public censure for reviving the "yusin" dictatorship from the outset of its office, the present puppet conservative regime of south Korea is making every desperate effort to arrest the struggle of the popular masses from all walks of life against its election rigging through its terror-ridden campaign for eliminating "forces following the north," though truth about the fraudulent election has been disclosed in succession.
					
					 This campaign reminds one of the period of "yusin" dictatorship in which the fascist junta brutally suppressed and punished democratic figures and innocent people who stood in its way of maintaining its power after labeling them "pro-communists" and "elements advocating alliance with communism".
					
					 Even the political parties, organizations, politicians, religionists and men of literature and arts desirous of democratic reforms of south Korean society resolutely turned out in actions for democracy as they hate all sorts of social evils and injustice.
					
					 The GFUALK Central Committee voices full support and solidarity with the struggle of the south Korean people of all social strata and bitterly denounces the bestial moves of the puppet group of traitors to crack down upon social progress and democracy, reflecting voices of justice and conscience. 
					
					 In south Korea even the call for elementary right to live and democracy is considered as a crime and free expression of will and free activities are subject to merciless crackdown after being branded as "acts of following the north".
					
					 We men of literature and arts are pioneers steering the times, censuring injustice with pens of justice and microphones of conscience.
					
					 The gruesome situation of south Korea calls on the men of literature and arts to become torches indicating truth and standard-bearers of justice and take the lead in the actions for independence, democracy and reunification. 
					
					 No matter how hard the puppet conservative group may try to quell the voices of justice and conscience with fascist suppression, victory belongs to the men of literature and arts and other people of south Korea in their patriotic actions for justice.

articles.title: Romanian Photo Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Romanian Photo Exhibition Opens
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A Romanian photo exhibition was co-sponsored by the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, the Romanian embassy to the DPRK and the Korea-Romania Friendship Association.
					 It took place at the Pyongyang Center for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries on Wednesday to mark the 65th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Romania and the 95th national day of Romania.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were officials concerned, working people in the city, the charge d'affaires ad interim and staff members of the Romanian embassy here.
					
					 Present there on invitation were foreign diplomatic envoys, representatives of international bodies and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 The participants went round photos introducing Romanian scientists and inventors.

articles.title: DPRK Shows Deep Care for Disabled Persons
articles.content:
DPRK Shows Deep Care for Disabled Persons
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Officials related to the work with the disabled in the DPRK held a seminar here on the occasion of the International Day of Persons with Disabilities (December 3). The seminar dealt with the successes and experience gained in their work after the adoption of the Law on Protection of the Disabled in June Juche 92 (2003).
					 In the DPRK the disabled persons are given the same legal rights and benefits as ordinary people's under the government's protection policy and it has become a tendency of society to preferentially treat and take warm care of them.
					
					 In recent years the DPRK has made a signal progress in the work with disabled persons.
					
					 Regular surveys have been made on their health conditions, recovery treatment and education and necessary measures taken to improve their situation. And activities have been conducted to give wide publicity to the contents of the Law on Protection of the Disabled and improve the system of work with the disabled.
					
					 This year the Munsu Recovery Center took its shape in Pyongyang. And the first sports establishment for the disabled is now under construction. It will include a gymnasium, training ground, recovery facility, etc.
					
					 The Amateur Table-Tennis Tournament has been held annually from Juche 99 (2010), with an aim to improve the health of disabled persons and make them enjoy their life in an optimistic manner. Consequently, the DPRK proved successful in swimming and table-tennis events of the 3rd Asian Youth Para Games.
					
					 Meanwhile, the DPRK has strengthened exchange and cooperation with other countries and international bodies in the field of protecting the disabled and signed the UN convention on rights of the disabled in July.
					
					 The seminar discussed on measures for improving the work with the disabled in conformity with the changed situation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Devoted Efforts for Building Thriving Nation Always Remembered by Korean People
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Devoted Efforts for Building Thriving Nation Always Remembered by Korean People
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The people in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have become strong in yearning for leader Kim Jong Il with the approach of the 2nd anniversary of his demise, December 17.
					 Kim Jong Il always found himself among the people in his lifetime, making a long journey covering nearly 670 000 km to give on-the-spot guidance to different fields of the country even in inclement or hot weather conditions.
					
					 It was his motto that people's interests should be put ahead of all others and he would always remain a son of the people.
					
					 He never allowed even a slightest move contrary to the interests of people.
					
					 While remaining true to his promises with the people, he never cared about himself, spending days and nights in guidance tours until the last moments of his life.
					
					 During the last days of his life, he guided a flight training of a unit of the Korean People's Army (KPA) honored with the title of O Jung Hup-led 7th Regiment, toured the Amusement Park in Kaeson Youth Park and appreciated a figure skating demonstration and a performance given by soldiers of KPA companies who proved successful at the 35th Art Festival of KPA Servicepersons. He also went to South Hamgyong Province to give field guidance to its different sectors, guided a firepower strike drill of a KPA unit and visited the Hana Musical Information Center and the Kwangbok Area Supermarket.
					
					 Indeed, Kim Jong Il was a peerlessly great man and patriot who dedicated his all to laying eternal foundations for the wellbeing and happiness of the people, overcoming all sorts of ordeals and difficulties.
					
					 His immortal exploits performed on behalf of the country and nation will remain forever in the hearts of the people.
					
					 It is a steadfast will of the DPRK people to hold him in high esteem for all ages.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps U.S. Frantic Arms Buildup in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps U.S. Frantic Arms Buildup in S. Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the United States decided to sell 40 F-35s to south Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a commentary in this regard: 
					
					 The U.S. aim of this arms sale is to prod the south Korean puppet group overheated with the ambition for invading the north into igniting a new war on the Korean Peninsula at any cost. Washington's another aim is to bring profits to the U.S. munitions monopolies. 
					
					  The U.S. is contemplating arming the south Korean puppet army with latest military hardware in a bid to launch a war against the DPRK through a preemptive attack on it.
					
					 Air strike is a key mode employed by the U.S. in carrying out its war scenario for aggression. That is why the U.S. is providing fighters with powerful striking capability to the south Korean puppet forces and staging frequent joint military drills with them with main emphasis on large-scale air striking drills and operations to destroy depth of the DPRK.
					
					 These war moves of the U.S. are rendering the situation on the Korean Peninsula and in its vicinity tenser.
					
					 The U.S. deliberate acts of pushing the situation on the peninsula to an extreme phase by instigating the south Korean puppet forces may entail serious consequences and in that case the U.S. will be held wholly responsible for them.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Denounces U.S. Dangerous Arms Buildup
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Denounces U.S. Dangerous Arms Buildup 
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is getting ever more undisguised in its moves to deploy latest weapons and equipment and troops in the Asia-Pacific region. 
					 It is mulling deploying latest sea patrol plane P-8A Poseidon in Japan for the first time and MV-22 Osprey on Guam. 
					
					 It was reported that stealth destroyer DDG-1000 would belong to the U.S. Pacific Fleet and operate soon in Pacific waters and MH-60 naval choppers and Virginia-class attack submarines in Hawaii would be deployed. 
					
					 It was also reported that the U.S. Navy would increase the present number of Aegis ships 26 to 36 by 2018 and deploy most of them in this region and that the U.S. Army is examining the introduction of the THAAD using missiles with longer range and higher altitude interception capability than PAC-3. 
					
					 What matters is that, timed to coincide with these military moves, brass hats of the U.S. are vying with each other to vociferate about the theory of "threat from north Korea". 
					
					 The U.S. secretary of Defense at the 2013 World Security Forum blustered that north Korea poses the most complicated and provocative threat and the chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff uttered that the north's threat is a matter of greatest concern in Asia. 
					
					 The commander of the U.S. Pacific Fleet openly cried out for coping with "north Korea's missile and nuclear threats" with strong deterrence. 
					
					 This is, in fact, sheer sophism and nothing but a brigandish claim reminiscent of "the guilty party filing the suit first". 
					
					 Who threats whom? 
					
					 Now U.S. nuclear powered aircraft carriers and many other warships, fighters and nuclear weapons are deployed in the Asia-Pacific region. More than 280 000 U.S. troops are deployed there, the biggest military presence in the world. It is quite clear that they are the main factor of extremely escalating the tension in the region including the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The DPRK's deterrence for self-defense serves as a treasured sword to protect the sovereignty of the country and security of the people from the U.S. moves to militarily stifle the DPRK and its ambition for world domination. It threatens nobody unless its sovereignty and security are infringed upon. 
					
					 It has already declared this several times and it is firmly preserving the principle at present. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. is desperately floating the fiction about "threat from north Korea". This is nothing but a crafty ploy to cover up its true colors as the arch criminal rendering the regional situation unstable and create an environment favorable for carrying out its pivot to Asia-Pacific strategy. 
					
					 The U.S. arms buildup is part of its pivot to Asia-Pacific policy to establish its domination and control over the region by dint of its military and nuclear supremacy. 
					
					 It is pushing forward the massive deployment of the armed forces, prompted by its scenario to contain the "dangerous forces" challenging it in the region and maintain and strengthen its military supremacy. 
					
					 The U.S. arms buildup is sparking off strong caution among China, Russia and other regional countries as it is the root cause of a new Cold War. 
					
					 The U.S. is the very arch criminal threatening the regional peace and stability. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to stop such arms buildup.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Slammed for Suppressing Democratic Forces
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Slammed for Suppressing Democratic Forces
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article denounces the south Korean puppet ruling forces for kicking up a racket for eliminating the "forces following the north" to mislead public opinion and create a horror-ridden atmosphere of suppression.
					 This is a product of fascist intrigues to arrest the anti-"government" struggle of the people against such hideous frauds as the interference of the Intelligence Service in the election through a ridiculous coloring offensive and thus disorganize and stamp out progressive and democratic forces and quell the mass popular resistance, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The conservative group's frantic racket for eliminating the "forces following the north" is a just copy of the "yusin" dictator's brutal method whereby he ruthlessly cracked down on progressive organizations and figures and patriotic people who called for independence, democracy and reunification by branding them as "pro-communist elements."
					
					 Such racket reminds one of the fascist hangmen who punished democratic figures and organizations on charges of being "spies" for the mere reason that they called for the same peace and reunification as what the north did.
					
					 What the puppet group is seeking through the above-said racket is to suppress the just struggle of people of all social strata for achieving democracy by labeling it rampage of the "forces following the north" and, at the same time, to sow seeds of discord among progressive and democratic forces and bar them from getting united, turn the whole of south Korea into a graveyard of democracy where fascist dictatorship reigns and thus realize the wild ambition for long-term office.
					
					 If people hesitate to wage a positive struggle and shun the unity of progressive and democratic forces, deterred by the conservative group's horrible racket, the whole progressive and democratic camp desirous of independence, democracy and reunification will fall a victim to the revival of the "yusin" dictatorship.

articles.title: Koreans in China Flay S. Korean Regime's Moves to Revive "Yusin" Dictatorship
articles.content:
Koreans in China Flay S. Korean Regime's Moves to Revive "Yusin" Dictatorship
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China on Nov. 25 issued a statement  in denunciation of the south Korean ruling forces' moves to revive the "yusin" dictatorship and escalate fascist suppression.
					 It said:
					
					 The remnants of the "yusin" dictatorship, which had been thrown into a dumping ground of history, are raising their heads along with the appearance of the present conservative ruling forces. They are nostalgic of the "yusin dictatorship", jabbering that "yusin era was better" and "there should be dictatorship."
					
					 Overseas compatriots still remember that the ill-famed "yusin" dictatorial regime ran the whole gamut of illegal and cruel acts and atrocities against not only compatriots in south Korea but those overseas after stretching out its tentacles to them.
					
					 It is a tragedy in the 21st century and a shame on the nation that such dictatorship is being revived in south Korea.
					
					 The remnants of the "yusin" dictatorship are getting frantic with the revival of the dictatorship, crying out for the elimination of the "forces following the north" just as the "yusin" dictator brutally cracked down on the pro-reunification movement under the motto of "eliminating pro-communists".
					
					 All Koreans in China voice positive support for the struggle of the south Korean people and call on them to intensify their actions for achieving social democracy and checking the revival of the "yusin" dictatorship.

articles.title: Paper of Koreans in Uzbekistan Introduces DPRK
articles.content:
Paper of Koreans in Uzbekistan Introduces DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Thongil, the newspaper of Koreans in Uzbekistan, carried a special write-up on November 21.
					 The paper edited impressions given by a Korean artiste in Uzbekistan after taking part in the celebrations of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK in September, illustrated with photos of the parade of Worker-Peasant Red Guards, the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, and the Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification.
					
					 In the impressions the artiste expressed great excitement at watching Marshal Kim Jong Un standing in the tribune of honor at Kim Il Sung Square when the parade of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards was taking place and drew strength and courage from the columns of the paraders and weaponry and equipment passing through the square in fine array and the single-minded unity of the army and people. 
					
					 The visit to the International Friendship Exhibition House offered me an occasion to keenly feel the reverence of the world people for the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the artiste noted, and continued:
					
					 Modern Changjon Street and service centers for the people such as Rungna People's Pleasure Park built under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Un helped me know about his policy of love for the people.
					
					 The paper carried photos of Koryo Sungkyunkwan Academy, the Nam Gate of Kaesong, Manwoltae, Kaesong Walls, Sungyang School and Kaesong Chomsongdae Observatory, historic relics of Kaesong registered as world cultural heritages.
					
					 Under the title "Results of contest baffling imagination " the paper introduced news that DPRK divers came first in the 2013 Grand Prix Diving Game (stage 6) sponsored by the International Federation of Swimming in Kazan, Russia.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Guinea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Guinea
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was formed in Guinea on November 27.
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events for praising the noble revolutionary career and immortal exploits of leader Kim Jong Il between November 27 and December 20.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by Guinean Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by Guinean Figure
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Banou Keita, chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, lauded leader Kim Jong Il at an inaugural ceremony of the committee for remembering him on November 27.
					 The chairman said at the ceremony:
					
					 Kim Jong Il developed in depth the immortal Juche idea and exalted the dignity of the country and nation by pursuing original Songun politics.
					
					 He glorified the DPRK as an invincible socialist power by relying on its powerful military capability under the banner of Songun.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un is successfully carrying forward the noble idea and exploits of Kim Jong Il, who devoted himself to the country and its people and the cause of socialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A joint committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed on November 27. It groups political parties and organizations under the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.
					 The committee has Mozgovoy, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union and chairman of the International Social Federation "For the Union and Union’s Communist Party", as its chairman and figures of its affiliated political parties and organizations including the Communist Workers  Party of Russia, the Communist Party of Kyrgyzstan, the Communist Workers' Party of Belarus, the International Social Federation "For the Union and Union’s Communist Party", the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, etc. as its members.
					
					 The joint committee decided to form committees of various political parties and organizations for remembering Kim Jong Il and hold diverse political and cultural events to introduce his noble revolutionary career and immortal exploits between December 10 and 20.
					
					 It also decided to introduce his greatness through publications.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Slovakia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Slovakia
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A Slovak committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Bratislava on November 28.
					 Ivan Draxler, chairman of the Slovakia-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee set the remembrance period from November 29 to December 18 and decided to organize diverse political and cultural events including remembrance meeting and film show to introduce revolutionary career and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by Bangladeshi Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by Bangladeshi Figures
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi figures issued statements on November 28 on the occasion of the 2nd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, said:
					
					 We look back upon the immortal exploits Kim Jong Il performed for the Korean revolution and the global cause of independence on the occasion of the 2nd anniversary of his demise.
					
					 He was an outstanding leader who led the Workers' Party of Korea and the army and people of the DPRK to victory with profound ideas and theories and extraordinary leadership, being possessed at the highest level of the disposition and traits of a great man.
					
					 His immortal revolutionary exploits will shine forever in the hearts of not only the Korean people but the progressive people.
					
					 M. Zahangir Khan, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, said:
					
					 H.E. Kim Jong Il was an outstanding statesman who successfully led the anti-imperialist and anti-U.S. struggle and the drive for building socialism in the DPRK.
					
					 His demise was a great loss to not only the Korean people but also world progressive people.
					
					 We are sure that the army and people of the DPRK will achieve greater successes in the efforts to achieve peaceful reunification of the country and build a thriving nation under the Songun guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Denounced by Bulgarian Organization
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Denounced by Bulgarian Organization
						
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism issued a statement on November 26 denouncing the south Korean authorities for suppressing the progressive political party.
					 The statement said:
					
					 In south Korea so-called intelligence institutions have intensified the moves to investigate and arrest members of the Unified Progressive Party and sympathizers with them and refer them to court on the basis of fabricated evidence.
					
					 The south Korean regime and its master U.S. are afraid that the influence of patriotic reunification forces may increase and, therefore, are trying to bring back the dark era of fascist dictatorship and escalate confrontation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We extend solidarity to all the progressive forces in south Korea in their efforts for peace, democracy and independent reunification of the country and denounce the south Korean authorities for the political suppression of them.

articles.title: FGEAC condena campana de autoridades surcoreanas para acabar con el progreso social
articles.content:
FGEAC condena campana de autoridades surcoreanas para acabar con el progreso social
						
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El vocero del Comite Central de la Federacion General de Escritores y Artistas de Corea hizo publica el dia 3 una declaracion condenatoria a la banda titere surcoreana que intenta acabar con el progreso y la democratizacion de la sociedad.
					Las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas, criticadas por la sociedad desde el principio de su mandato por el renacimiento de la dictadura de "Yusin", hacen todo lo posible para detener la lucha masiva de distintos sectores, que denuncian los fraudes de las elecciones "presidenciales" que se revelan uno tras otro, mediante la "purga de las fuerzas pro-Norte" (de Corea), senala la nota y continua:
					
					Esa ola de represion hace recordar la epoca dictatorial de "Yusin" cuando se reprimia y se ejecutaba indiscriminadamente a las personalidades democraticas y los habitantes inocentes, quienes representaban escollos para el mantenimiento del "poder", acusandolos de "pro-comunistas".
					
					Partiendo de su odio a todos los males sociales y la injusticia, los partidos politicos, las entidades, los politicos, los religiosos y hasta los literatos y artistas se levantaron resueltamente en la lucha para la democracia, insistiendo en la reforma democratica de la sociedad surcoreana.
					
					El Comite Central de la Federacion General de Escritores y Artistas de Corea envia apoyo total y solidaridad a la gigantesca lucha de los habitantes surcoreanos condenando categoricamente la represion de la banda surcoreana uniendo las voces de justicia y conciencia.
					
					Cualquier persona que demanda los derechos elementales de la vida y la democracia resulta acosada como criminal y la libre expresion de opiniones y la libertad de actividades son objetos de represion como actos "pro-Norte". Esto es la realidad surcoreana de hoy.
					
					Nosotros, los literatos y artistas, somos precursores que guian la epoca denunciando la injusticia con la pluma y el microfono de justicia.
					
					La horrible realidad surcoreana de hoy exige a los literatos y artistas ponerse al frente de la lucha por la independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion iluminando la verdad.
					
					Aunque la banda conservadora surcoreana trata de suprimir las voces de justicia y conciencia con la cadena de fascismo, la victoria estara al lado de los literatos, artistas y habitantes del Sur de Corea levantados en la lucha patriotica por la justicia.

articles.title: Premiados ameritados en construccion de Complejo de Piscinas de Recreacion de Munsu
articles.content:
Premiados ameritados en construccion de Complejo de Piscinas de Recreacion de Munsu
						
　Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Fueron premiados en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea los militares y trabajadores que contribuyeron a construir el Complejo de Piscinas de Recreacion de Munsu como creacion monumental de la epoca del Partido del Trabajo.
					　Al respecto, quedo publicado el 27 de noviembre el decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC.
					
					　Gracias a la infinita fidelidad y la abnegacion heroica de los constructores militares  dispuestos del espiritu de cumplir sin falta la orden del Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Un, la obra fue terminada apenas durante 9 meses.
					
					　Segun ello, el titulo del Heroe del Trabajo, la Medalla de Oro "El Martillo y la Hoz" y la Orden Bandera Nacional de primera clase fueron otorgados a Kim Song Gil, Yang Chol Ung y Ryu Hwa Ryol, el Premio de Honor Juvenil Kim Il Sung a Kim Yong Su, y el Premio de Honor Juvenil Kim Jong Il, a Hong Hyon Il, Pak Kwang Nam y Kim Chung Hyok, respectivamente.
					
					　En tanto, se concedieron el titulo de chofer benemerito a 2 personas, la Orden Bandera Nacional de primera clase a 18, la Orden del Trabajo a 13, la Orden Bandera Nacional de segunda clase a 18, la Orden Conmemorativa de Construccion de la Capital a 737, la Orden Bandera Nacional de tercera clase a 120, la Medalla del Merito Militar a 97, la Medalla del Merito Laboral a 9 y la Medalla Conmemorativa de Construccion de la Capital a mil 234.

articles.title: Crece en RPDC la atencion social a discapacitados
articles.content:
Crece en RPDC la atencion social a discapacitados
						
　Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia Internacional de Discapacitados (3 de diciembre), tuvo lugar en esta capital el simposio de los funcionarios encargados de las labores con ellos.
					　En el foro fueron discutidos los exitos y experiencias logrados en esas labores despues de publicada la ley de proteccion de los discapacitados en junio del 92 (2003) de la Era Juche.
					
					  En virtud de la politica del gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de proteger a la poblacion invalida, se establecio el ambiente social de respetar y atender a ellos que tienen los mismos derechos legales e intereses que los ciudadanos normales.
					
					  Se realiza regularmente la investigacion sobre la gravedad de defectos fisicos de los discapacitados, el tratamiento de rehabilitacion y la calidad de educacion que reciben ellos y se toman las medidas correspondientes.
					
					  Tuvo lugar una serie de actividades para divulgar la ley de proteccion de los discapacitados y completar el sistema de labor con ellos.
					
					  Este ano, se construyo en la zona de Munsu el centro de rehabilitacion y esta en marcha la construccion del primer establecimiento deportivo para la poblacion invalida compuesto del estadio, la sala de entrenamiento y la de terapia y rehabilitacion.
					
					  Se realiza anualmente a partir del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche el Torneo de Tenis de Mesa de Discapacitados y Aficionados con el objetivo de fomentar la salud publica de los discapacitados y hacerles contribuir a la sociedad y al colectivo.
					
					  Especialmente, los jugadores coreanos obtuvieron exitos alentadores en las disciplinas de la natacion y ping-pong de los III Para-Juegos Asiaticos de la Juventud demostrando los aspectos de su vida digna que llevan en el regimen socialista centrado en las masas populares.
					
					  En la rama de proteccion se intensificaron el intercambio y la cooperacion con otros paises y organizaciones internacionales.
					
					  En julio de este ano, la RPDC firmo el convenio de la ONU sobre los derechos de los discapacitados.
					
					  En el simposio arriba mencionado, se tomaron las medidas para mejorar las labores de la rama conforme a la demanda de la realidad en desarrollo.

articles.title: Inaugurada exposicion de fotos de Rumania en Pyongyang
articles.content:
Inaugurada exposicion de fotos de Rumania en Pyongyang
						
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada el dia 4 en el Centro de Intercambio Cultural con el Extranjero de Pyongyang la exposicion de fotos de Rumania por el 65o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas con la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y del 95o  del Dia Nacional de este pais europeo, en nombre del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, la embajada rumana en Corea y la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Rumania.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los funcionarios, trabajadores capitalinos, el embajador interino y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica rumana en Corea.
					
					 Fueron invitados los representantes diplomaticos y otros miembros de las embajadas de varios paises, representantes de las organizaciones internacionales, acreditados en Corea.
					
					En la ceremonia inaugural hicieron uso de la palabra.
					
					 Los participantes recorrieron las fotos alusivas a los cientificos e inventores rumanos.
